name: MONSTER CHILDREN MAGAZINE ISSUE #41
description: Don’t worry, the issue is better than that joke. Much, much better. We’ve got so much cool stuff in #41, it’s kind of embarrassing to be another magazine right now. During this trip round the print press, we talk with freshly crowned pro skater Sammy Winter, surfer Conner Coffin, artist Ed Ruscha (Yes, really!) and those awesome dudes from No Age. Sound good? We think so. Get it here, now. Right now.

name: SLIDE YOUR BRAINS OUT
description: Growing up in southern California, artist, photographer and filmmaker Thomas Campbell was raised on the DIY aesthetic of the early 1980s skateboarding culture. Photography tips came from like-minded fellow photographers employed in the skateboarding press rather than from school, and art history was a matter of osmosis, not academia. In the mid-1990s, Campbell moved to New York and immersed himself in the scene around Alleged Gallery, where he quickly befriended and exhibited among the generation of artists who would star in the landmark 2004 exhibition Beautiful Losers. Campbell began documenting surfing culture in the late 1990s through both photography and film. His first feature-length film, The Seedling, came out in 1999, followed by Sprout in 2004 and The Present in 2009. Campbell's surfing photography has long been admired among by fellow surfers for its lack of gloss finish; unlike most, he eschews the familiar fish-eye shots or tightly cropped land angles. The first of ten projected volumes in Um Yeah Press' surf photobook series, Slide Your Brains Out compiles work from the past 15 years. Often lo-fi and gritty, other times lush and saturated, Campbell's compositions--which include portraits and action shots of some of the best surfers in the world--are always surprising and full of emotion, from melancholy to exultation.

name: THE CALIFORNIA SURF PROJECT
description: Chris Burkard, a talented photographer, and Eric Soderquist, a professional surfer, cajoled their Volkswagen bus along Highway 1 from the Oregon border to the Tijuana Sloughs and discovered everything the Golden State's legendary coastline has to offer.

name: THE HISTORY OR SURFING - MATT WARSAW
description: Matt Warshaw knows more about surfing than any other person on the planet. After five years of research and writing, Warshaw has crafted an unprecedented history of the sport and the culture it has spawned. At nearly 500 pages, with 250,000 words and more than 250 rare photographs, The History of Surfing reveals and defines this sport with a voice that is authoritative, funny, and wholly original. The obsessive nature of this endeavor is matched only by the obsessive nature of surfers, who will pore through these pages with passion and opinion. A true category killer, here is the definitive history of surfing.

name: FOLKLORE / SANCHO 9'
description:
The only thing you're going "below" with this board is the border. Whether they're fast sections or pocket noserides, this board cruises them like a low rider through Compton.

9'0"
22 3/8"
18 3/8"

name: FOLKLORE / MAR MAR 9' 2"
description:
See the sea longer on this nine-foot superstar. MAR MAR was designed to coast through those fast beach breaks. A concaved nose for steady, speedy noserides and pinched rails to keep you on track. A battail that turns on a dime and gives back a buck eighty.

9'2"
22 3/4"

name: FOLKLORE / CAPTAIN 5' 8"
description:
Forged from hell, you'll be at home at the helm of CAPTAIN. Wind chops to barrels, you'll be stylin' and sailin' all day. Don't mistake this old-school vibe, the CAPTAIN loves to put on rail.

5'8"

name: FOLKLORE / MAC GIVER 5' 8"
description:
Face it, you and your board just aren't seeing eye to eye anymore. You're bored. At first sight you loved those machined lines but year after year and the mediocre rides, you're left yearning for something more. Have a little four-fin foreplay with this handcrafted beauty.

Once you go MAC, you never go back.

5'8"
20 3/4"
2"
Moon
Quad

name: D'EMPLOI ROLL TOP BACKPACK (BLACK OR BROWN): $295
description:
-Heavy 18oz waxed canvas and 6oz chrome oil leather construction. 
-Solid cast brass and black ox steel hardware. 
-Points of stress riveted for strength. 
-Fully padded back panel gives structure to large loads. 
-Deadstock duck hunter camo liner with water-resistant coating. 
-Padded laptop pocket with iPad, pen & accessory pockets inside. 
-Leather pockets on the outside for easy access/water bottle. 
-Brass snaps at the opening keep the bag slim during smaller loads. 
-Parachute-quality nylon webbing. 
-24" x 12.5" x 6.5" when unrolled.

name: BRAITHWAITE, AMBER TORTOISE
description:
Translucent amber tortoise frame. Brown lenses. 100% UV protection. Fits medium to larger faces. Wicket & Craig® vegetable-tanned leather case, designed and made in the USA by Makr.

Frames and lenses are constructed from a lightweight, renewable plant-based bio-plastic.  High-density silicone nosepads for better weight distribution. Flexible, curved temples. 

Adjustable nosepiece provides control over distance from cheekbones to frames. Gently press the nose pad arms in towards each other to have the frame sit higher off the face and cheekbones, or away from each other for a closer fit.

144 mm wide × 52 mm high. Temple 146 mm. Base curve 6.

name: MONSTER CHILDREN : ISSUE #40
description: It is! In it you will find an amazing surf story shot by the amazing Hedi Slimane, an interview with guitarist and legend Matt Sweeney, a chat with the stunning Jessica Hart,  a trip to Seattle for Sub Pop’s Silver jubilee, a chin-wag with Kevin Terpening about rolling around on a piece of wood for a living, Bryan Ray Turcotte shows us his outrageously extensive collection of punk ephemera, and Matilda Price does her laundry. It’s the best issue yet.

name: THE SURFER'S JOURNAL 22.6
description: The Craig Anderson speed run on the cover of 22.6 is a mere prelude to expansive coastal waters and wave-riding pursuits brought to you in this issue—embedding in French Polynesia, Iceland, and Baja; documenting all-time Rapa Nui with Ramon Navarro and disaster relief with Jon Rose; profiling longboard innovators of the present and surfing exhibitionists of the past.

name: MALIN+GOETZ - PEPPERMINT SHAMPOO
description:
Synthesizing natural peppermint extract with hydrating amino acid proteins to effectively purify and balance all hair and scalp types, including processed hair and sensitive scalps. Calming neroli and moisture-rich proteins strengthen and protect leaving hair healthy and scalp conditioned.

	•	All hair types 
	•	0.3% Peppermint Extract. All Hair Types. Amino Acid Hydration 
                Technology
	•	Amino acid hydration technology
	•	Natural fragrance and color
	•	8 oz / 236 mL bottle

name: MALIN+GOETZ HAIR CONDITIONER
description:
A perfect supplement to their renowned shampoos, (Malin+Goetz) brings us a conditioner which makes use of the remedying qualities of cilantro.  A synthesis of natural cilantro and absorbant fatty acids effectively hydrates and pH balances all hair and scalp types.  Suitable for daily use, it is blended for advanced, residue-free conditioning and detangling.

	•	All hair types 
	•	1.2% cilantro extract 
	•	Fatty acid absorption technology
	•	Natural fragrance and color
	•	8 oz / 236 mL bottle

name: MALIN+GOETZ - POMADE
description:
A natural, firm-hold hair styling aid from the skin, body and haircare experts at (Malin+Goetz).  The pomade offers matte, residue-free grooming without weighing down or irritating the scalp by synthesizing meadowfoam seed, cannabis sativa seed, and soybean with absorbant fatty acids for moisture, definition and texture.  A blend of yucca and aloe plant extracts helps to prevent damage.

	•	All hair types 
	•	Meadowfoam seed extract 
	•	Fatty acid absorption technology
	•	Natural fragrance and color
	•	2 oz / E 57 g bowl

name: MALIN+GOETZ - STYLING CREAM
description:
A gentle and hydrating shampoo for all hair types from the masters at (Malin+Goetz).  A synthesis of natural peppermint and amino acid cleansing agents purifies and balances all hair and scalp types.  Suitable for daily use, the mildly foaming formula rinses without residue, drying, stripping, irritation and build-up.

	•	All hair types 
	•	1% peppermint extract 
	•	Amino acid hydration technology
	•	Natural fragrance and color
	•	4 oz / 115 g tube

name: MALIN+GOETZ - EUCALYPTUS DEODERANT
description:
(Malin+Goetz) have perfected the staple of every man's medicine cabinet with a synthesis of refreshing eucalyptus and odor-neutralizing citronellyl.  One use lasts the entire day and is appropriate for all skin types.  The absence of aluminum also ensures that you will be left without residue and without yellow stains.

	•	All skin types
	•	Alcohol and aluminum free
	•	0.1% Eucalyptus extract 
	•	Advanced absorption technology
	•	24 hour effectiveness
	•	Natural fragrance and color
	•	2.6 oz / 73 g can

name: RUSSIA : THE OUTPOST VOL. 1
description:
Russia, The Outpost Vol. 1 surf DVD + Book by Chris Burkard and Ben Weiland follows Keith Malloy, Dane Gudauskas, Cyrus Sutton, Trevor Gordon, Foster Huntington, Chris Burkard, and Ben Weiland as they journey into the remote wilderness of the Kamchatka Peninsula, camping and fishing along the way, in a groundbreaking search for surf and adventure.

The Book is 5-1/4" x 7-1/4" in size and has 108 pages of photography by Chris Burkard with editorial by Ben Weiland.

name: Groundswell DVD
description: Surfers Dan Malloy, Trevor Gordon and Pete Devries set sail on a 68 foot sailboat guided by the Raincoast Conservation Foundation into British Columbia's Great Bear Rainforest where a pipeline and oil tanker proposal looms. The team explores waves and a rainforest full of life while learning of the potential irreversible consequences of this project from local First Nations leaders.

name: The Heart & The Sea DVD
description: The Heart & The Sea surf DVD by Freefilms is the third release from independent Australian filmmaker Nathan Oldfield, the creator of the highly regarded left of center surf films Lines From a Poem and Seaworthy.

name: Dear Suburbia DVD
description: It is a high-performance, location based surf film set against exotic landscapes, objects and personalities juxtaposed with the traditions of suburban life. Spontaneity versus routine. The unknown versus the familiar.

name: Sight Sound DVD
description: Sight Sound surf DVD by High Seas Films and Mikey DeTemple is filmed on location in Central America, Maritime Provinces New York, Bahamas, Baja Mexico and Maine.

name: Singlefin: Yellow DVD
description: Singlefin: Yellow surf DVD by Build Worldwide, tells the story of one surfboard's life as it travels the globe shared by a group of friends.

name: Lost Atlas DVD
description: Kai Neville is the director of 2009's game-changing surf film Modern Collective. Starring the sport's six most innovative surfers, the film was like a series of machine gun blasts across the bow of contemporary surfing. This August, Kai Neville released Lost Atlas, featuring the original six from Mod Coll and introducing surfing's newest guns.

name: The Endless Summer DVD
description: The Endless Summer surf DVD by Bruce Brown. Mike Hynson and Robert August were among the world`s best surfers in the mid-1960s. Bruce Brown was a surfing enthusiast with a few largely unseen films on the sport. The three became legendary when Brown followed the two Californians around the world, filming their quest for the perfect wave in THE ENDLESS SUMMER.

name: Picaresque DVD
description: Picaresque surf DVD by High Seas Films and Mikey DeTemple is set to a soulful vibe. Great longboarding. Great locations. Great music.

name: Let's Surf Seriously DVD
description: Let's Surf Seriously surf DVD by Transworld Surf. ​Featuring Chippa Wilson, Dylan Graves, Mason Ho, Benji Weatherley, Greg Long, Ozzie Wright, Nate Tyler, and so many more.

name: LOST WEEKEND NYC TOTE
description:
100% COTTON. MADE HERE. UNISEX.

$10
